oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military commission for Samuel Rankin Latta
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Commission for Capt. Samuel Rankin Latta (1827-1910). Latta was of Irish descent. He was reared in Pennsylvania and moved to Dyersburg, Tenn., where he was a lawyer, teacher, Presbyterian elder, Sunday school superintendent, and Mason. Latta married Mary Mary Guthrie (1833-1920) on Dec. 9, 1852. He was commissioned in June 1861 and served in the 13th Tenn. Vol. Inf. Regt., CSA. He is buried in Dyer County, Tenn.
